content.description: Climb the tornado shaped overhanging wall.
content.location: Located on the boulder just right of Nerve Damage. It climbs the overhanging face on the roadside next to Nerve Damage.

content.description: Stand start with hands on vertical edges.  Move up to a slopping horizontal seam, then slopping dishes to an easy top out.
content.location: On the northwest corner of the Nerve Damage boulder.

content.description: Start at the rail and trend left to its end.  Make a large move to a positive crimp and then jugs to the finish.  Easy mantle.
content.location: In the middle of the west side of the Nerve Damage Boulder.

content.description: The highball line facing the old road. Starts on two good incuts then traverses on good pockets.  Ends up on the arete.
Start low on pod and move up and right, meeting and turning arete to exit on slab.
content.protection: Pads. Climbs over a small boulder on that New Joes friable stuff, so tread carefully.
content.location: Line on the right side of the Lady Hips boulder.

content.description:
A great technical climb that offers something a bit different from the usual overhanging climbing at New Joe's.

Stand start with a left hand pocket right hand undercling/pinch.  Good techy crimping and pinching, with good feet along the way, to a doable topout.  Overall a great climb and a good change of pace.
content.location: Very close to Nerve Damage.  If you're looking at ND the 'Kill' boulder with LH's on it is to your left about 100 feet down the road on your right.  Hard to miss.

content.description: SDS, climb the vertical incut cracks to an easy mantle
content.location: North face of Nerve Damage, see pic

content.description: Sit start, move through pockets like on Big Lebowski, then go towards the big hole and top out.
content.location: On the corner to the right of nerve damage.

content.description: SDS, pull through pockets and sidepulls to the obvious L hand jug.  Easy mantle.
content.location: Northwest corner of Nerve Damage, see pic

content.description:
Cool holds, and interesting moves lead to satisfying jugs. Start sitting, and do the steep crux moves to get established on the wall. Angle up and right, looking for the path of least resistance. It gets easier the higher you go.

I thought these moves were about as hard as the crux moves on Self-Service or Salsa Verde (hence the v3+), but I was on rest day without much skin, and these holds are little sharp, so I could be wrong.
content.protection: You really want more than one pad on this, and a spotter, as it has an uneven landing and traverses. It's not a serious problem like Nerve Damage, by any means, more like an ankle twister.
content.location: Around the corner to the right from the Nerve Damage Prow, on the same boulder, you'll find The Big Lebowski.
